comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: This photo was used in The [New York] Sun., September 01, 1912, THIRD SECTION, Image 29 chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn83030272/1912-09-01/ed-... in connection with society preparing to leave Newport, R.I. after their summer stays. Photo attributed to Campbell Studio According to www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GSob=c&...; she would be his third wife, Clara Doyle Moreland. They had homes in Pittsburgh and New York. He was an officer of the Carnegie Steel Company and its successor Carnegie Company. See NYT of March 28, 1900 query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F30B1EFC355811738...

comment.author: 77318933@N08
comment._content: I have to say... old is gold... not sure if such beauty still exists.

comment.author: 35014516@N03
comment._content: swanq: Thanks for finding Mrs. Morelands name for us.  We'll include it next time we update the descriptiion.
